result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar I. Luera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders 25% of prison wages to be applied towards court obligations.

**Amended to reflect sentence credit per order**
Concurrent with: with 15CF41

superMiscConds.notes:
DNA sample
Maintain compliance with Sex Offender Registry Program
Shall not have access to the Internet, computer, or electronic devices with WiFi capabilities without agent approval
Complete all programming deemed appropriate by DOC
Payment of Court cost, supervision fee and any other fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Recalled by Court. Defendant Omar I. Luera in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Court completes the written determinate sentence.  Def is not eligible for the challenge incarceration or substance abuse program.

Defendant Omar I. Luera in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Omar I. Luera in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF41 & 15CF57.  Presentence report filed.  Reviewed by parties.  No corrections.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Victim has prepared written statement, read-in to the record by the victim witness coordinator.  M.H. presents statement to court.  Sentencing arguments presented by Atty Uttke.  State request 40 yrs prison, 20 yrs initial Conf. and 20 yrs extended supervision in 15CF41.  15CF57 State request to follow presentence. Concurrent.   Atty Debord presents sentencing arguments.  Requesting probation after imposed and stayed sentence. Min prison time requested.  DA makes correction 20 initial and 15 extend.   15 years is max sentence for extended supervision.  Nothing by def.  Court presents sentencing statement.   Court orders 15CF41  Ct 3 - Prison  20 yrs.  10 yrs initial conf & 10 yrs extended supervision  Court cost ordered.  No letter of apology is being ordered by court, reasons given.  DNA sample and surcharge ordered.  Court orders 25% of prison wages to be applied towards cost.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Rules of supervision outlined in presentence.  No contact with MAH.  Court reads conditions on page 16 of report.  Court will not order employment request.  Balance of conditions ordered.  Cts 1 & 2 were dismissed and read in   Court orders presentenc sealed.  State request complaint be sealed, reasons given.  Court reviews  complaint.  State will withdraw request.  15CF57 Ct 2 was dismissed and read in.  Ct 1 - Concurrent prison sentence.  3 yrs prison.  1 yr initial conf.  2 yrs extended sup.  Concurrent.  Court cost ordered.  DNA surcharge.  Sames conditions.   Felony conviction rights reviewed.  Stipulate to 250 days already served, so ordered.  Applies to both counts.  Post conviction rights

Defendant Omar I. Luera in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Defendant Omar I. Luera in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF41 and 15CF57 @ 2:33 p.m. State has complied with victim notification requirements. 15CF41 will plea to ct 3, cts 1 & 2 dismiss and read in, 15CF57 Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in. State requesting PSI and both sides will be free to argue. Atty Debord and Def agree. Court reviews plea quest. 15CF41 ct 3 - no contest plea. 15CF57 ct 1 - no contest plea. 15CF41 cts 1 &2 dismissed and read in. 15CF57 ct 2 dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights reviewed, waived by Def. Elements and possible penalties reviewed. Atty Debord makes statement, is satisfied. Court finds pleas freely, voluntarily & understandingly made. Factual basis stipulated. Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF41 ct 3 and 15CF57 ct 1. Joint request for PSI. Court orders PSI and report. Off the record for scheduling.  Sentence hrg 12/10/15 @ 10:00 a.m. Report to be delivered by 11/30/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Omar I. Luera in court & in custody with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CF41 & 15CF57 @ 2:02 pm.  Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver finds freely and voluntarily given and binds over. Information's filed.  Atty Debord has copy of informations, waives reading & enters Not Guilty plea to both cases. Court receives not guilty pleas on both cases and clerk to enter pleas. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Omar I. Luera in court in custody with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF57 and 15CF41.  Doctor Galli appears by phone.  Report has been filed.  Doctor Galli duly sworn on oath, testitifies.  Brief statement by Atty Uttke.  Response by Atty Debord.  Court will accept report.  Court will find def competent to proceed.  Preliminary to be set.  Time limits waived for preliminary.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
No contact with victim # 1 and no contact with minor females

Defendant Omar I. Luera in court vai video with attorney Brent Harold DeBord.  Defendant Omar I. Luera in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, reviewed.  Statement by Atty DeBord.  Request competency examination.  This will apply to 15CF41 and 15CF57.   Court so orders competency examine.  Bond that was set in 15CF41 will apply towards this case also.  Bond set  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
